ReportSection.ReportItem:
The TVN Interdisciplinary Fellowship Program provides funds for Fellow income. Fellows are not prohibited from receiving other funding, however TVN funding is subject to NCE stacking provisions and other guidelines, so Fellows are required to identify all other sources of support that relate to the Fellow, or to the personal Fellowship project, including fellowship or scholarship revenues, and research or other grants – no matter what the status, i.e. whether planned to be applied for, being applied for, about to be submitted, submitted, pending, etc... – for the entire period covered by the Fellowship.

Details on in-kind and financial partnership contributions must also be identified. Partnership contributions must be from NCE-eligible partners and cover NCE-eligible expenses. Please consult the Tri-Council guidelines regarding eligibility and valuation of in-kind contributions and then consult with your supervisor’s host institution’s research services unit for assistance if you still have questions. Calculation of in-kind contribution amounts must adhere to Tri-Council guidelines.

If you are listing a partner with cash or in-kind contributions that was not included in your application, please provide a letter from the partner detailing the extent of collaboration and cash/in-kind contributions. The letter must specifically identify your project, reference TVN funding, and detail the type and amount of contributions. The letter should be on official letterhead from the partner, and must be signed by someone from the partner with the authority to make such a commitment.

Please note that where an applicant has a “financial interest” (as defined by NCE Conflict of Interest Guidelines) in a partner, the potential conflict of interest should be declared. These partnerships are not precluded, but declaring this financial interest provides transparency to the administration and review process. Applicants are also governed by TVN Conflict of Interest Policy and Guidelines.

{$item} * Fiscal Year runs from Apr.1 to Mar.31.
